Level 2 classification Tidy Modeling

Level 2 classification Tidy Modeling: using Recipe to down sample.

data preparation

read data

library(tidyverse)

hotels <- readr::read_csv("https://raw.githubusercontent.com/rfordatascience/tidytuesday/master/data/2020/2020-02-11/hotels.csv")
Rows: 119390 Columns: 32
── Column specification ────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
Delimiter: ","
chr  (13): hotel, arrival_date_month, meal, country, market_segment, distrib...
dbl  (18): is_canceled, lead_time, arrival_date_year, arrival_date_week_numb...
date  (1): reservation_status_date

ℹ Use `spec()` to retrieve the full column specification for this data.
ℹ Specify the column types or set `show_col_types = FALSE` to quiet this message.
hotel_stays <- hotels %>%
  filter(is_canceled == 0) %>%
  mutate(
    children = case_when(
      children + babies > 0 ~ "children",
      TRUE ~ "none"
    ),
    required_car_parking_spaces = case_when(
      required_car_parking_spaces > 0 ~ "parking",
      TRUE ~ "none"
    )
  ) %>%
  select(-is_canceled, -reservation_status, -babies)

  count(children)

hotel_stays %>%
  mutate(arrival_date_month = factor(arrival_date_month,
    levels = month.name
  )) %>%
  count(hotel, arrival_date_month, children) %>%
  group_by(hotel, children) %>%
  mutate(proportion = n / sum(n)) %>%
  ggplot(aes(arrival_date_month, proportion, fill = children)) +
  geom_col(position = "dodge") +
  scale_y_continuous(labels = scales::percent_format()) +
  facet_wrap(~hotel, nrow = 2) +
  labs(
    x = NULL,
    y = "Proportion of hotel stays",
    fill = NULL
  )

data split

hotels_df <- hotel_stays %>%
  select(
    children, hotel, arrival_date_month, meal, adr, adults,
    required_car_parking_spaces, total_of_special_requests,
    stays_in_week_nights, stays_in_weekend_nights
  ) %>%
  mutate_if(is.character, factor) %>% rename(target_variable=children)
set.seed(1234)

data_split <- initial_validation_split(data=hotels_df, prop = c(0.7,0.2))

data_train=training(data_split)  

data_test=testing(data_split)  

data_valid=validation(data_split)
dim(data_train)
[1] 52616    10
dim(data_test)
[1] 7517   10
dim(data_valid)
[1] 15033    10

modeling

recipe

becasue the target class is not balance so using downsample

data_rec <- recipe(target_variable ~ ., data = data_train) %>%
  step_downsample(target_variable) %>%
  step_dummy(all_nominal(), -all_outcomes()) %>%
  step_zv(all_numeric()) %>%
  step_normalize(all_numeric()) %>%
  prep()

prep the recipe

data_rec=data_rec %>% prep()
data_rec
── Recipe ──────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
── Inputs 
Number of variables by role
outcome:   1
predictor: 9
── Training information 
Training data contained 8424 data points and no incomplete rows.
── Operations 
• Down-sampling based on: target_variable | Trained
• Dummy variables from: hotel, arrival_date_month, meal, ... | Trained
• Zero variance filter removed: <none> | Trained
• Centering and scaling for: adr and adults, ... | Trained

bake the train data with preded recipe

train_proc <- bake(data_rec, new_data = data_train)
train_proc2 <- bake(data_rec, new_data = NULL)
train_juice <-juice(data_rec)

the difference between train_proc and train_juice is that the train_juice is been down sample.

dim(train_proc)
[1] 52616    23
dim(train_proc2)
[1] 8424   23
dim(train_juice)
[1] 8424   23
train_proc %>%
  count(target_variable)
# A tibble: 2 × 2
  target_variable     n
  <fct>           <int>
1 children         4212
2 none            48404

the juice and train_proc2 target is down sample to 1:1

train_proc2 %>%
  count(target_variable)
# A tibble: 2 × 2
  target_variable     n
  <fct>           <int>
1 children         4212
2 none             4212
train_juice %>%
  count(target_variable)
# A tibble: 2 × 2
  target_variable     n
  <fct>           <int>
1 children         4212
2 none             4212

bake the test data with preded recipe

test_proc <- bake(data_rec, new_data = data_test)
valid_proc <- bake(data_rec, new_data = data_valid)

juice(pre_recipe,data=NULL) is same as bake(pre_recipe,data=hotel_train) for training data (excepted down sample)

model

tree model

tree_spec <- decision_tree() %>%
  set_engine("rpart") %>%
  set_mode("classification")

KNN model

knn_spec <- nearest_neighbor() %>%
  set_engine("kknn") %>%
  set_mode("classification")

trainning

knn_fit <- knn_spec %>%
  fit(target_variable ~ ., data = train_juice)

knn_fit
parsnip model object


Call:
kknn::train.kknn(formula = target_variable ~ ., data = data,     ks = min_rows(5, data, 5))

Type of response variable: nominal
Minimal misclassification: 0.2705366
Best kernel: optimal
Best k: 5
tree_fit <- tree_spec %>%
  fit(target_variable ~ ., data = train_juice)

tree_fit
parsnip model object

n= 8424

      * denotes terminal node

model result

Evaluate

Make predictions on the testing data

predictions <- predict(tree_fit,test_proc) 

predictions_probability <- predict(tree_fit,test_proc,type="prob")
data_test_result=cbind(data_test,predictions,predictions_probability) 
conf_mat(data_test_result, truth = target_variable,
    estimate = .pred_class)
          Truth
Prediction children none
  children      484 1966
  none          141 4926

save model

check model size

library(lobstr)
obj_size(tree_fit)
1.66 MB

bundle and save model

library(bundle)
model_bundle <- bundle(tree_fit)
saveRDS(model_bundle,'level2_model.RDS')

make predication

load model and unbundle

model=readRDS('level2_model.RDS')

model <- unbundle(model)
final_prediction=predict(model,valid_proc)

head(final_prediction)
# A tibble: 6 × 1
  .pred_class
  <fct>      
1 none       
2 none       
3 children   
4 none       
5 none       
6 none       
final_prediction_data=cbind(valid_proc,final_prediction)

conf_mat(final_prediction_data, truth = target_variable,
    estimate = .pred_class)
          Truth
Prediction children none
  children      916 4013
  none          320 9784
